checks.name: Computational Mirages

issues.description: Computational mirage: mean operation destroys variance information
Computational mirage: mean operation destroys variance information
Computational mirage: premature_discretization operation destroys variance information

recommendations: Use VariationTensor to preserve statistical metadata during aggregations
Track variance and distribution information alongside mean values

checks.name: Statistical Validity

issues.description: Statistical test ttest_ind() called inside a loop. Multiple comparisons require p-value correction.
issues.statistical_impact: Running multiple statistical tests inflates the false positive rate. With 20 tests at alpha=0.05, you have a 64% chance of at least one false positive (1 - 0.95^20).
issues.corrected_interpretation: Apply Bonferroni correction: divide alpha by number of tests, or use Benjamini-Hochberg for FDR control.
issues.recommendation:
from statsmodels.stats.multitest import multipletests
rejected, corrected_p, _, _ = multipletests(p_values, method='fdr_bh')

issues.description: Conditional logic based on p-value detected. This pattern enables selective reporting.
issues.statistical_impact: Conditioning on significance leads to publication bias. Non-significant results are equally important for science.
issues.corrected_interpretation: Report ALL results regardless of significance. Use pre-registration to prevent outcome-dependent analysis.
issues.recommendation: Remove conditional branching on p-values. Report effect sizes and confidence intervals instead of just significance.

recommendations: Apply Bonferroni correction for multiple comparisons
Report mean and std across multiple seeds, not best result

checks.name: Dimensional Consistency

issues.description: Variable 'g' suggests dimension [M] but is assigned value with dimension [1].
issues.physical_meaning: Variable naming implies a physical quantity different from what is being assigned. This may indicate a unit conversion error.
issues.recommendation: Verify units. If intentional, rename variable to match actual dimension or add explicit conversion.

issues.description: Cannot add quantities with dimensions [T] and [1].
issues.physical_meaning: This is like adding apples to oranges. The result has no physical meaning.
issues.recommendation: Check for missing unit conversions. Ensure both operands represent the same physical quantity.

issues.description: Cannot add quantities with dimensions [L] and [T].
issues.physical_meaning: This is like adding meters to seconds. The result has no physical meaning.
issues.recommendation: Check for missing unit conversions. Ensure both operands represent the same physical quantity.

issues.description: Variable 'force_impact' suggests dimension [L M T^-2] but is assigned value with dimension [L M T^-1].
issues.physical_meaning: Variable naming implies a physical quantity different from what is being assigned. This may indicate a unit conversion error.
issues.recommendation: Verify units. If intentional, rename variable to match actual dimension or add explicit conversion.

issues.description: Comparing quantities with incompatible dimensions: [L^2 M T^-3] vs [1].
issues.physical_meaning: Comparing physically incompatible quantities. The comparison result is meaningless.
issues.recommendation: Convert to same units before comparing, or verify this comparison makes physical sense.

issues.description: Cannot add quantities with dimensions [M] and [1].
issues.physical_meaning: This is like adding apples to oranges. The result has no physical meaning.
issues.recommendation: Check for missing unit conversions. Ensure both operands represent the same physical quantity.

issues.description: Variable 'mass_limit' suggests dimension [M] but is assigned value with dimension [1].
issues.physical_meaning: Variable naming implies a physical quantity different from what is being assigned. This may indicate a unit conversion error.
issues.recommendation: Verify units. If intentional, rename variable to match actual dimension or add explicit conversion.

recommendations: Add explicit unit annotations to variable names
Use dimensional analysis to catch physics errors

verdict: FAIL: Critical scientific integrity issues detected
